channel.title: heute:pop:morgen podcast
channel.description:
Having it's home on Tide 96.0 in Hamburg (Germany), heute:pop:morgen is now available as a podcast hosted by Jonas Woost. In what he calls 'electronic post-pop' he plays everything between downbeat and electro, indietronica and post-rock, IDM and pop with the idea that electronic music can be accessible to everyone. On heute:pop:morgen you might hear David Bowie next to Alter Ego, Laurent Garnier next to Yo La Tengo, Four Tet next to Basement Jaxx and Cassius next to Kings Of Convenience and it will all make sense keeping in mind that genres are just guidances and not boundaries.
www.hpmradio.com
channel.itunes:author: Jonas Woost
channel.itunes:subtitle: radio show for electronic post-pop

www.hpmradio.com
channel.itunes:keywords: electronic, leftfield, electronica, netaudio, music, tracks

item.title: heute:pop:morgen 02/09/2009

1. Schneider TM 'The Light 3000'
2. Kings Of Convenience 'I Don't Know What I Can Save You From' (Röyksopp Remix)
3. Mugison 'Sweetest Melody'
4. Lali Puna 'Nin-Com-Pop'
5. Frightened Rabbit 'Set You Free'
6. Phoenix 'Everything Is Everything'
7. Sufjan Stevens 'Chicago'
8. Mia Doi Todd 'My Room Is White'
9. Flunk 'True Faith'
10. Chromeo 'Needy Girl'
11. The Teenagers 'Homecoming' (Gentelmen Drivers Rave Mix)
12. Superdiscount 'Fast Track' (Featuring Julien Delfaud_Alex Gopher)
